alert.note: Alert for Fulton; Knox (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Central Illinois (Central and East Central Illinois)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 08 at 4:47PM CDT until July 08 at 6:45PM CDT by NWS Central Illinois
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR NORTHWESTERN FULTON AND KNOX COUNTIES... At 445 PM CDT, trained weather spotters reported flash flooding in Galesburg and Knoxville, with numerous streets and intersections flooded. Between 1.5 and 3.5 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Trained spotters reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Galesburg, Abingdon, Knoxville, Farmington, Wataga, Avon, Yates City, London Mills, Maquon, Rio, Gilson, East Galesburg, Henderson, St. Augustine, Delong, Dahinda, Middle Grove and Galesburg Airport. Moderate rain is moving out of northeast Fulton County, with light showers possible over the next hour. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
